result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thalis M Joiner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thalis M Joiner appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Thalis M Joiner.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thalis M Joiner appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Thalis M Joiner.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Tiara Sheets-Walker - MPD Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thalis M Joiner appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Thalis M Joiner.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing.  State counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. Objections from defense. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Case set for a preliminary hearing on 8/26/22 at 9:00 am. Defense counsel is unavailable. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 8/24/22 at 9:30 am. Parties notified via email.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KKJ (DOB 4/12/06) UNLESS CONTACT IS PERMITTED OR ALLOWED BY DMCPS OR ANY ORDER IN CASE NO.22JC475.

Defendant Thalis M Joiner in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/08/2022@130pm
